description: On April 16, governor Henry Falan of Yap State in Micronesia announced a curfew across the state by issuing a "Restrictions of Movement of People" decree that would apply to all Yap State residents between the hours of 7:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m., seven days a week.
"President David W. Panuelo of Micronesia (FSM) declared a State of Public Health Emergency" that applies to all citizens in order "to protect the Nation and its citizens from the new coronavirus".
President David Panuelo amended his initial emergency declaration of January 31, 2020  to place a time limit on the declaration's validity

"All citizens of Micronesia are banned from travelling to mainland China and other countries with confirmed cases of Coronavirus until further notice and until such a time that a determination is made that the Coronavirus is effectively maintained. Other citizens, nationals, and residents in FSM are strongly advised against taking unnecessary travel to mainland China and other countries, states, and territory with confirmed cases of Coronavirus until the situation is reassessed and found to be under control"
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: "Persons travelling directly or indirectly, either by air or sea transport, from anywhere in mainland China since January 6, 2020, are banned from entering into the FSM."
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Persons travelling into the FSM from countries , states, or territories with confirmed cases of the Coronavirus (other than mainland China) are not allowed to enter the FSM unless they have stayed in a country, state, or territory with no confirmed cases of Coronavirus for a period not less than 14 days immediately prior to their entry into FSM.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On February 13, 2020, the FSM Congress lifted previously-imposed travel restrictions and quarantine requirements for persons traveling from countries other than China.

description: President David Manuelo amended the emergency declaration of January 31, 2020 to include the following clarified article: Regarding commercial sea vessels (fishing vessels, cargo vessels, and oil tankers), they shall all be subject to Customs, Immigration & Quarantine (CIQ) and additional health inspection procedures, and are allowed to continue to deliver goods, commodities or supplies  provided that they have spent 14 uninterrupted days at sea. Crewmembers are allowed to disembark their vessels only in the performance of required operational duties, and only within immediate dock facilities. Fishing vessel crews may be allowed onshore provided that their 14 uninterrupted days at sea are verified and are cleared by Health authorities.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: President David Manuelo amended the emergency declaration of January 31, 2020 to include the following clarified article: Regarding commercial sea vessels (fishing vessels, cargo vessels, and oil tankers), they shall all be subject to Customs, Immigration & Quarantine (CIQ) and additional health inspection procedures, and are allowed to continue to deliver goods, commodities or supplies  provided that they have spent 14 uninterrupted days at sea. Crewmembers are allowed to disembark their vessels only in the performance of required operational duties, and only within immediate dock facilities. Fishing vessel crews may be allowed onshore provided that their 14 uninterrupted days at sea are verified and are cleared by Health authorities.

description: President David Manuelo amended the emergency declaration of January 31, 2020 to include the following: "regarding commercial airlines conducting regular transit service through the FSM, crewmembers and technical support personnel on board the aircraft may exit the aircraft in order to carry out inspection and regular duties around the aircraft, but they are not permitted to enter any airport facilities except for those necessary for the safe operation of the airplane.

On February 28, 2020, President David Manuelo amended the emergency declaration of January 31, 2020 by extending the original 14-day travel restriction until March 13, 2020. The restriction means that all persons travelling into FSM from countries, states, or territories with confirmed cases of the coronavirus (other than mainland China) are not allowed to enter into the FSM unless they have stayed in countries, states, or territories with no confirmed cases of the Coronavirus for a period of no less than 14-days immediately prior to their entry into the FSM

On March 12, The FSM removed previously re-imposed travel restrictions placed on people travelling from countries with cases of the coronavirus. Only travellers from Hubei Province are still banned from travel to the FSM, and local citizens are also banned from travelling to the Chinese province.

description: On March 16, 2020, The State of Chuuk reiterated FSM President David Manuelo's State of Emergency Declaration, adding that: (1) any person suspected to have symptoms of COVID-19 shall be isolated upon the direction of the Director of the Department of Health Services; (2) any person who are tested positive for COVID-19 shall be placed in an isolation for a period to be determined by the Department of Health Services; and (3) all person who may be exposed carriers of COVID-19 and symptoms of high fever, coughing, flu like symptoms and shortness of breath shall submit to and comply with the treatment in accordance with the instruction and protocol of the Department of health services.

description: A task force was established "to coordinate all activities that need to be undertaken and measure that must be formulated and implemented in connection with the Coronavirus. The Department of Health is designated as lead department and chair of the Task Force, which will be responsible for setting up plans to provide any necessary measures that will ensure that the movement of people and international travellers to no cause the introduction of Coronavirus anywhere in the FSM"
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: President David Manuelo amended the emergency declaration of January 31, 2020 to re-impose the 14-day quarantine period that had been lifted. This means that all persons travelling into FSM from countries, states, or territories with confirmed cases of Coronavirus (other than mainland China) are not allowed to enter the FSM unless they have stayed in countries, states, or territories with confirmed cases of the Coronavirus for a period of no less than 14 days immediately prior to their entry into the FSM.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: President David Manuelo amended the emergency declaration of January 31, 2020 to re-impose the 14-day quarantine period that had been lifted. This means that all persons travelling into FSM from countries, states, or territories with confirmed cases of Coronavirus (other than mainland China) are not allowed to enter the FSM unless they have stayed in countries, states, or territories with confirmed cases of the Coronavirus for a period of no less than 14 days immediately prior to their entry into the FSM. UPDATE: On February 28, the FSM President issued another amendment extending the original mandatory 14-day quarantine period from February 28 to March 13 2020.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: On August 25, President David Panuelo of the Federated States of Micronesia signed a decree setting the national standards on social distancing measures. Every person is strongly encouraged to practice social distancing at all times in public by maintaining a space of at least six feet between persons.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
